Class ThreadPool

java.lang.Object

public final class ThreadPool
extends Object

A simple thread pool.

Author:
Philip Aston

Nested Class Summary
static interface ThreadPool.InterruptibleRunnableFactory
          Factory that is called to create an InterruptibleRunnable for each thread.

Constructor Detail

ThreadPool

public ThreadPool(String name,
                  int numberOfThreads,
                  ThreadPool.InterruptibleRunnableFactory runnableFactory)
Constructor.

Parameters:
name - A name for the thread pool.
numberOfThreads - Number of threads.
runnableFactory - Factory which defines what our threads should do.
Method Detail

start

public void start()
Starts the threads.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - If the thread pool has already been started, or has been stopped.

stop

public void stop()
Shut down the thread pool.

stopAndWait

public void stopAndWait()
Shut down the thread pool and wait until all the threads have stopped.

isStopped

public boolean isStopped()
Return whether stop has been called for this thread pool.

Returns:
true => stop has been called.

getThreadGroup

public ThreadGroup getThreadGroup()
Return the thread group used for our threads.

Returns:
The thread group.
